turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You better get over to Al's. Now.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I was supposed to meet him for breakfast. He likes that new IHOP they just opened, you know... He likes to order that thing. The Rutti- Tutti-Fresh and Fruity thing they got.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Miles...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Sorry. I'm just... Look what they did to him. Right in the middle of his egg-foo-young.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It's bad luck.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Just an idea, but let's just fucking split. We'll meet up anywhere. Akron or Austin or Atlanta. Anywhere...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: He'll find us. We go talk to him.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Do we want insurance?  I'm just asking...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Just mail it to the hospital.  Mr. King, please. It's regarding an accounting problem. Yes... Correct... I know where it is. That will be fine. Thank you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Meet me at my place later.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: How do you know the King's going to let you walk?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm getting a ride.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You better hurry. The police will be here any second.  I don't really understand my motivation with this. Why am I washing glasses?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Now you're an accomplice in a homicide. Everything you thought you were in control of just flew out the window or is dripping down your leg.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We're working for the King.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Wait a second... Who's the mope?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No. Big con. One rag. One rag and we get out from under all this. But we need another Shill.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What do we need another Shill for?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Breasts.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Because that's who the King Pin wants us to fleece. And Gillette's perfect...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Uh...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I'm just thinking out loud here, but... Two million in a briefcase?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Good point.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It never worked before because A, they didn't flush the bank enough; B, their corporate papers were for shit; C, they didn't have someone on the inside with Customs.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, or D, it's a dumb fucking idea...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Then what do you want to do, Miles? Run?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: We never had a problem with that before.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah, well we never had this kind of problem before.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What are you talking about? Yes we have. And we would have been beautiful about it. We would've had a bucket of chicken delivered to the King with a nice kiss my ass card attached to it. Then we woulda moved on 'til the next local putz caught on.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We're getting a little old for running.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Yeah, well we're still a little young for Albany State Prison. Are you pissed about Al? I'm pissed too, but I'm not like "twenty-five to life" pissed.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm getting clear of this. If you're not going to do it for the fucking principle, do it for the money. Gordo?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Is it all fugasi?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, the corporate papers have to be legit. But you gotta score an I.D. A clean one. Talk to Suits. I gotta get us a Banker.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What you're looking for in a mark is someone who's weakness you can exploit.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Michelle Strigo. Loan officer.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Him.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: But if you wanna talk about bad luck...

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Where the hell is she?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: So this is our boss, right? He chases me and Miles out of his office and he's yelling and screaming, "You're fired! Your whole team's fired!" He starts looking for Lily, Lupus, Gordo --

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: But the best part was that he couldn't find Gordo! He was in the bathroom. So he finally goes in there, kicks in a stall door and starts yelling! And there's Gordo, pants at the ankles, holding a PC World Magazine!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What do we do? We change the scam?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: There is no scam! I've got a fucking sign on my back! I can't leave town now and come back with a suitcase full of money. You get it? It's over. We walk.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, no, no! Not this time. I am doing this for your own good! You guys have got to learn when to stop. You with the Armani! You with the hookers!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Escorts!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Do you even remember Al? Do you remember what he looked like sitting there?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Feeling lucky today, Miles. Found a penny -- Heads up. There was an empty cab right outside my building. We hit every green light.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And we got rid of the red head.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And we got rid of the red head.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Jake? Customs?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Excuse me? I believe you're holding something far me under Pearson.

turns.speaker: SALESGIRL
turns.text: Do you have a ticket?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You know, this is kind of embarrassing, but my wallet was stolen yesterday and I'm afraid the ticket was in it. But the name's Pearson.

turns.speaker: SALESGIRL
turns.text: I'm sorry. Nothing under Pearson.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're sure? This is... Just a complete disaster.

turns.speaker: SALESGIRL
turns.text: What was it?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: A ring for my wife. A lot like that one. In fact, it was that one.

turns.speaker: SALESGIRL
turns.text: That's no problem. We have those in stock.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Thank you. Sorry, I'm just a little anxious to give it to her. You take out of state checks?

turns.speaker: SALESGIRL
turns.text: With identification.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I understand that, but I had my wallet stolen last night. Is there any way..?

turns.speaker: SALESGIRL
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I know it's policy, but...  The thing is... It's our first anniversary and we're only in town for the weekend. It's a very, very special night for my wife and I. This ring is my gift to her and I think she's going to really love it. I can give you phone numbers to call for people who'll vouch. I can send you I.D. later...

turns.speaker: SALESGIRL
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: This is embarrassing.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: When this is all over, you're going to tell me who the King put on Al.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: You going to have the time?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'll find the time.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: King ain't gonna like this.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't worry, I'll settle up with your boss. We haven't skipped town yet.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: What I'm saying is, is that the King ain't gonna care. See he had a real thing with getting this Gillette guy, If you ask me I think he's jealous.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Of what? They're both crooks.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: Exactly. 'Cept this Gillette guy. He gets to walk around in three piece suits, hob knob with the Mayor, own a bank, that kinda shit. Meanwhile, the King sits holed up in the steam, afraid to even take a leak without me or Harlin watching the door.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: My fucking heart bleeds.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: Your buddy. That fat guy. The King couldn't wait to have that guy whacked. He didn't even know who the guy was, but he was so pissed off at him, he gets him drilled. It ain't personal. It's business.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Point, Lupus. Give us a point.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: Point is, you don't go through with this, he's going to go after you next. And he don't even like you, Jake.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Oh, you know... Don't fuck this up. I'll kill you. I'll kill your family. I'll shoot your dog... All the usual. Then he said good luck.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: So that's it, huh? You get the cops to give you a safe ride.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Let me ask you something... You really think I'm going to come this close, this fucking close and let my guard down? I'll get square with your boss. I'll get square with whoever did Al. I'll get square with everybody. Then I'm going going to cash in my chips and be on my way to a new and better me far away from here.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: You're a weasel.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: He's wheeling around two million dollars in cash and he wants to stop to use the bathroom. You believe this?

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: Maybe he's got it right. Maybe we're all just looking for a safe place to shit.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That was fucking deep.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What's up with you? Bladder infection?

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: Keep it up.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: You really like that bitch don't you? I gotta tell you, I was pretty convinced that the whole thing before was blowing her off for her cut. You know how it is, get her to do some shit for you, throw her a bang to keep her happy. But, if you're into her... That's cool.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's what I like about you, Lupus. You're a free thinker. Don't let the King tell you different.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Egg Foo Young.  Stand up.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Stand up.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: No offense, but I've seen you fight. You gotta be kidding m-

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Eee Oott Auught!

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: Sorry. What?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: HE GOT CAUGHT! Your boss tried to pull a switch and he got us all fucking pinched!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And like in a game of chess, you've played every possible move in your head...

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: You were right. He's trying to fuck you. You want it, you gotta get it at the airport...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Aces, Suits.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: Not easy pickin's. Papers like these speak to larger issues. Sorry about Alfonse.  You into something big?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Pretty much.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: In over your head?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Pretty much.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: Can I speak to you in confidence?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Huh? Oh. She's alright.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: Try and keep up... You ask for the Advantage Goods, then you guys come in looking to be Bean Traps. So I gotta think you're either working the mace or playing the Jug Mob.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: A little bit of both.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: Hey, I been on the ramp all my life, so I got no problem with the way you help yourself, Jake.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: I saw you go up from the Knecker, working that Grind, learning the Barnard's Law and I thought, "the kid's a prodigy." But I know that if you're using these goods... So then I figure, what's worth that? You're either looking for a little history or a retirement fund. Who's the Mark?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Can't say.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: Then who's the Banker?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: The King.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: The King? Jake, you play the heavy rackets like that... They put the lug on for nothing at all.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I can handle it.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: I don't doubt your talent. You looking for that place in the hall of fame?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It's not history.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: So what do you want?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I want to get out from under all this for good. And I want to fuck them all doing it.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: Then I gotta say, in my opinion, you can't get what you want.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: Still time.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Can't do it Suits. I can't lay down for this one.

turns.speaker: SUITS
turns.text: Okay. Here's the thing... You fall flat, you might not get anything short of stiffed. Then it's Blue River Land for everybody. Papers like these are dangerous because papers tend to multiply, then they start to take shape. Usually it's the shape of an arrow. I hate to do it, but after this, I gotta give you the blowoff. We Jake, Jake?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Ten percent.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: You guys got sack, I'll give you that much.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Confidence. It's just confidence.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: Do you have any idea what those monks charge for that medieval torture?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We got a good thing going here. You want to blow it over an overbite?

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: The King, huh? Nice going.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I try.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Just a tip.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: What are we gonna do with this stuff anyway? Heroin? What the hell do you do with heroin?

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Consider him part of your crew. Consider him a part of me.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: Coupla things. They got this Fed looking around and the girl just split.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: A Fed? Is he close?

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: I don't think so. Their Fix gave us the heads up and Jake's got a plan that'll probably keep him off.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Speak.

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: He's landing. He's got a suitcase on wheels.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: So do half the other people in this place. How do I know which one?

turns.speaker: LUPUS
turns.text: I got it figured out... He's got this thing with bathrooms. If he makes it through Customs, he'll be heading for the john.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Good. Good. Do not let Vig out of your sight.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Special Agent?

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: You are Officer Richard Rottovich. And this would be Officer Walter Sobozinski. I'm looking for Jake Vig.

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: Preliminary forensics suggests he was sitting there, bloated and purple in his egg foo young for at least seventy two hours. Alfonse was not a small man and there was a lot of food ordered, so you can imagine the smell. Bad for the neighbors, good for me because in all the time I've been looking for Jake, this is only the second time I've even gotten a whiff of him.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Look Special Agent Moonan... We don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: If you Feds are so hot for him, why don't we just bring him in right now?

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: I want him for something big and to do that, we have to catch him in the act.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Like we told you before, we think he's into something with the King Pin --

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: Look, I'm not a confrontational person by nature.

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: Did he buy it?

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: I think so. What'd he ever do to you anyway?

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: Let's just say he burned me once.

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: You guys awake?

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: We're here.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: I've been looking for this Jake Vig for some time now. Problem is, the guy's the invisible man. A spook, a spectre, a ghost. Then, like a gift, Jake's good buddy and member of his crew, Alfonse Moorely, is found the other day with a hole in his head.

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: Do you want to know the first time I had a line on Vig? He sent me a birthday card.  Belated, but it's the thought, right? Oh, this prick's got a sense of humor. But, then again you guys probably know him better than I do. In fact, I've only met the guy once. But now, now I have you. The next best thing. His partners. His "Fix."

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: You help me catch him. Whatever he's into next, I want you to be into. And what you're into, I'm into. If it all goes well, those two guys from IAD will never have to hear this tape. I'll clear you guys of anything you've ever done with Vig under the guise of some cross- departmental investigation. This prick's been on the wish list for so long, you'll probably get gold shields out of it.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: What do you get out of it?

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: Peace of mind.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: Not everyone's on the take, Walter.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: This guy must have been a real pain in your dick.

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: Literally. It's not a bad deal, gentleman. I get peace of mind. You get Detective Sheilds. But this is the best part, Walter... Walter, your daughter will get to keep her braces and have that winning smile. Capice?

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: Good... I gotta go.  So, what do you have for me?

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: Whaddya mean? We got dick.

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: You guy's are not working with me here. I just got off the phone with my boss. After he got done ripping me a new Lincoln Tunnel size asshole, he let me know exactly how little I'm welcome back if we come up short. And now here you guys are, WASTING MY FUCKING TIME!

turns.speaker: MOONAN
turns.text: He's headed towards the eastern most exit. Do not, under any circumstances approach. I want to follow this all the way down to Vig.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: Roger that.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: You sell it.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: To who?

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Don't be an idiot. How hard do you think it is to sell one drug dealer's drugs to another drug dealer? If Vig's right, we might be looking at a hundred, maybe a hundred fifty grand...

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: You think this is a good idea? We never did this kinda shit before.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: What's he going to do? File a missing drugs report? If it works out, this guy might be good for a few more turns.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: Hope so. Those fucking orthodontist bills are killing me. One fifty every time they tighten those bitches up. One fifty! It's not even covered.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: It's cosmetic. They don't cover cosmetic. Last year I had a tooth capped. The dentist tells me I'm not covered for caps. It's cosmetic.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Bullshit it's cosmetic! My fucking tooth was cracked in half. I made the son of a bitch write it in as a cavity. The department's dental is for shit.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: Whoa, whoa... There he is.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: You trust this Moonan guy?

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: I don't trust anybody. You see how bad this guy wants Vig? It's like a sickness. I say we collar Vig ourselves. We got Vig, then we got leverage. And we trade; Vig for that tape. I want to see it right in front of my face.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: It's just insurance.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: That's what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: I'm down!

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SOBOZINSKI
turns.text: High five.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Put your hand down. I don't high five.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: I'm Bella.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jack Manfred.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Hi, Jack.  Welcome to the cesspit.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is it that bad?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: How do I look?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Jack. Do you need a ride?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No. Thanks.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: My car's in the garage.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Maybe another time.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: I'll take you up on that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: You're shaking.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's the tension.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I hate cheats.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: All men are cheats.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: But don't worry, I'm clean as a whistle. I only did S & M.  No blow jobs. No screwing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why did you quit?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: I got scared.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I can imagine.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Can you? I'm happy being a dealer. At least the punters keep their hands to themselves.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You called the casino a cesspit.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Well it is. But I know where I am.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: I've been watching you work. You're the best in the place. But you know that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I despise the job.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Ah, we all say that. But if we hate it, why do we do it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Indian rope-trick.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Look, now I'm pumping you. I'm sorry. It's none of my business. It's just that you're not like the others.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not like Matt, you mean.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Now he's a real shit. Don't get friendly with him. I'm sure he's got his hand in the till. You know what he said to me once? "I want to fuck the whole world over. That's my mission." The shit!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ouch.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: You fucking little shit! You shopped me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Reynolds got a doctor in. They forced me to take a dope test. It was positive. As you knew.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know anything about it.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Your boyfriend fucked me, smoked my dope, then shopped me. What do you think of that? I can't get a job now.  You bastard. You're no different from Matt. A pair of vicious little shits, that's what you are.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look Bella, I don't know anything about this. You should talk to Matt.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: You're all scumbags.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: What are you laughing at? Who was that on the phone?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A couple I know are getting married.

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: What kind of deal you looking to?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's the Blue Book price?

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: That's not relevant. An old car like this, it depends on the condition.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How about fifteen hundred?

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: How about five hundred.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: How about we split the diff... Seven-fifty.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is that your idea of arithmetic?

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: I'm not a mathematician. I'm in business.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Eight-fifty.

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: Seven-fifty.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Three years, two months. March '93.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: What a memory you've got. Maths always was your strong suit. What happened to the moaning Lisa?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She went back to South Africa.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Did she?  You were pretty thick at one time.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We all played the field.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Hi-ya... I'll call you back.  Now then...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I want a job, Giles.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: All right. As what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was thinking perhaps I could be a reader. You employ readers, don't you?

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: We do. For unsolicited manuscripts. We pay twenty pounds a manuscript. You might get two, maybe three in a week. Can you live on sixty pounds?

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: I thought it was you. It's the hair!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm working on that soccer story.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Right.  Look, I must get back to Habib.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Habib?

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: My author. He's a Terrorist. He's written a kill-and-tell book.  Take care.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Jack, look, next weekend I'm having a house party. Here...  It's near Oxford. Why don't you come? It'll just be social. No business.  Bring a friend. I've plenty of room.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll try and make it.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Looking forward!

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: She's a dab hand With a racquet, your friend.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: South African women are very sporty.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I found her in bed with someone.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Who was he?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't gamble.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Don't be a spoilsport. It's only a few quid.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's nothing to do with money. I don't gamble.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Last hand.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Hey. I've got an idea. Why don't we...

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: I get it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get what?  Are you accusing me of cheating?

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Good God, no. But with skill like that, what do you want a job for? You don't need to work.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: Good night?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not particularly.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: And your lady?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She had to leave early. She asked me to thank you.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: A bit unexpected, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not entirely.

turns.speaker: GILES
turns.text: How's that football story corning along?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You said it was going to be social, Giles. No business.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I couldn't resist them.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You mean I won't resist them.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: No, no. I'm not ready for you. There's some vodka in the freezer.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You want me drunk?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I won't be that long.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You really are a beautiful woman.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: It's not just inner beauty, is it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Turn around.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Where did you get it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I. sold the car.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You shouldn't have done that. I know what it meant to you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I owe you for the rent. It's only a car. I can get another.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Take it back. Till you sell your book.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come on, Marion. Let's face the truth. Nobody's going to publish it.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Of course they will. You just have to be patient. I'm betting on you.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You're my prisoner.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I've got something to tell you.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I want to hear it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I've got a job.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: What job?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: In a casino. As a croupier. A dealer.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: How did you land that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It came my way. 450 a week.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: 450? What did you do, just walked in and said I want to be a croupier? Don't you need training?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I had training. In the Republic.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You were a croupier there? You never told me that. I thought you just knew some gamblers.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I start Monday week.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You sold the car. You got a job. What's the third thing? Tell me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's no third thing. Don't be superstitious.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I love you Jack, you know that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are you trying to read my palm?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You've got such beautiful hands.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: What's the time?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: How did it go?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You're shaking. What is it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tension. It'll go.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Poor baby.  This'll relax you.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I loved it blond.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's only hair. I haven't changed.
